categories.shortInfo: created by Antigravity/Gemini3, one of the best UX solutions for start crud site, by Antigravity

outlineItems.line: category::start;created by Antigravity/Gemini3, one of the best UX solutions for start crud site, by Antigravity

prompt::create a Astro site with one page that displays employee records from a JSON file, it enables the user to create, edit, delete, sort and search employees, the employees are stored in a JSON file and CRUD calls are made to backend Node/Express server, the employee records have 7 fields of type string, number and date, the site has TypeScript, Tailwind 4, and a professional but reduced look with light gray, the site is responsive and cleverly solves horizonal scrolling of all fields in mobile view so that it is easy to edit records on a smartphone, use icons where appropriate, the Node/Express server and Angular can be started simultaneously with one "npm run dev" command
15 minutes finished, didn't ask me anything
works very nicely with modal on both desktop and mobile, could be the best UX yet
one small issue: there is a "ml>" on the bottom left of the screen

categories.shortInfo: created by Antigravity/Gemini3, HTML/CSS/JS site with images, Gemini created the images, colorful and professional, you edit a JavaScript object, good for servers where you can just serve simple HTML files

outlineItems.line: category::start;created by Antigravity/Gemini3, HTML/CSS/JS site with images, Gemini created the images, colorful and professional, you edit a JavaScript object, good for servers where you can just serve simple HTML files

prompt::create an HTML/CSS/JS website that gets its data from an imported file data.js which has projects items that have a slug, title, description and loads an image from /images/<slug>.jpg, the site should look professional, colorful but not too flashy, use subtle icons, its main purpose is to show projects with image/title/description that the	user can click on to go look at the project, it should be clear what they have to click on, desktop and mobile views should look different but both easy to navigate

categories.shortInfo: created by Antigravity/Gemini3, this is usable but has some odd UX features, e.g. editing and adding have a modal that make the background disappear, and mobile view scrolls horizontally instead of showing cards

prompt::create a Angular site with one page that displays employee records from a JSON file, it enables the user to create, edit, delete, sort and search employees, the employees are stored in a JSON file and CRUD calls are made to backend Node/Express server, the employee records have 7 fields of type string, number and date, the site has TypeScript, Tailwind 4, and a professional but reduced look with light gray, the site is responsive and cleverly solves horizonal scrolling of all fields in mobile view so that it is easy to edit records on a smartphone, use icons where appropriate, the Node/Express server and Angular can be started simultaneously with one "npm run dev" command
